variable_store.description: Internal shell variable store. Separate from the OS environment â€” variables are not exported to child processes unless explicitly passed.
variable_store.hashing: FNV-1a with chaining for collision resolution

api.Variables.init(n): Initialise the store with capacity n. Call once at startup.
api.Variables.get(name): Returns a raw pointer into the store. Do NOT free it.
api.Variables.delete(name): Remove a variable from the store.
api.Variables.destroy(): Free all memory. Call on shell exit.

variables.name: PS1
variables.description: The shell prompt string displayed to the user before each input. Contains ANSI color codes.
variables.notes: Rebuilt every time init_prompt() is called (e.g. after cd). Contains live USER, HOST, and PWD values embedded at build time.

variables.name: PWD
variables.description: The current working directory of the shell process.
variables.notes: Updated on every cd and on shell startup via init_prompt(). Falls back to HOME if getcwd() fails.

variables.name: USER
variables.description: The name of the currently logged-in user.
variables.notes: On Windows uses GetUserName(). On Linux/macOS reads from the password database via getpwuid().

variables.name: HOST
variables.description: The hostname of the machine the shell is running on.
variables.notes: On Windows uses GetComputerName(). On Linux/macOS uses gethostname().

variables.name: HOME
variables.description: The home directory of the current user.
variables.notes: On Windows reads USERPROFILE, falls back to HOMEDRIVE+HOMEPATH. On Linux/macOS reads HOME env var, falls back to the password database.
